---

# coolify_database_mariadb (Resource)

Manage a Coolify MariaDB database.

## Example Usage

```terraform
resource "coolify_database_mariadb" "mariadb" {
  name             = "my-mariadb"
  server_uuid      = "server-uuid"
  project_uuid     = "project-uuid"
  environment_name = "production"
  
  mariadb_database = "coolify"
  mariadb_user     = "coolify"
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `environment_name` (String) Environment name
- `name` (String) Database name
- `project_uuid` (String) Project UUID
- `server_uuid` (String) Server UUID

### Optional

- `description` (String) Database description
- `destination_uuid` (String) Destination UUID
- `environment_uuid` (String) Environment UUID
- `image` (String) Database image
- `instant_deploy` (Boolean) Instant deploy
- `is_public` (Boolean) Is the database public
- `limits_cpu_shares` (Number) CPU shares limit
- `limits_cpus` (String) CPUs limit
- `limits_cpuset` (String) CPUs set limit
- `limits_memory` (String) Memory limit
- `limits_memory_reservation` (String) Memory reservation limit
- `limits_memory_swap` (String) Memory swap limit
- `limits_memory_swappiness` (Number) Memory swappiness
- `mariadb_conf` (String) MariaDB configuration
- `mariadb_database` (String) MariaDB database name
- `mariadb_password` (String, Sensitive) MariaDB password
- `mariadb_root_password` (String, Sensitive) MariaDB root password
- `mariadb_user` (String) MariaDB user
- `public_port` (Number) Public port

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) Database identifier
- `status` (String) Database status

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

```shell
terraform import coolify_database_mariadb.mariadb "database-uuid"
```
